On this page

PoshUI v1.0.0 - Initial Release ​

Welcome to PoshUI v1.0.0! This is the first public release of PoshUI, a PowerShell UI framework for building professional Windows 11-style wizards, dashboards, and workflows.

PoshUI provides three PowerShell modules for building professional Windows 11-style applications without requiring WPF, XAML, or C# knowledge.

Three Modules ​

PoshUI.Wizard ​

Create step-by-step guided interfaces for configuration, deployment, and setup tasks.

PoshUI.Dashboard ​

Build card-based monitoring interfaces with metrics, charts, and interactive tools.

PoshUI.Workflow ​

Orchestrate multi-step automated processes with progress tracking, approval gates, and reboot/resume capabilities.

Carousel Banners ​

All modules support carousel banners with rotating slides, clickable links, and background images.

Capabilities:

  • Per-slide URLs with clickable "Learn More" button
  • Background images with opacity control
  • Auto-rotation with configurable intervals
  • Visual feedback with hover effects

Example:

powershell
$carouselItems = @(
    @{
        Title = 'Welcome'
        Subtitle = 'Get started with PoshUI'
        BackgroundColor = '#0078D4'
        BackgroundImagePath = 'logo.png'
        BackgroundImageOpacity = 0.15
        LinkUrl = 'https://github.com/ASolutionIT/PoshUI'
        Clickable = $true
    }
)

Add-UIBanner -Step "Welcome" `
    -CarouselItems $carouselItems `
    -AutoRotate $true `
    -RotateInterval 5000

Documentation: Carousel Clickable Links

Dashboard Cards ​

PoshUI.Dashboard provides dedicated cmdlets for each card type, making it easy to build monitoring interfaces.

Card Types ​

CmdletPurposeExample Use
Add-UIMetricCardKPI metrics with trends and targetsCPU usage, memory stats
Add-UIChartCardData visualization (Line, Bar, Area, Pie)Performance trends
Add-UITableCardTabular data displayServer lists, process info
Add-UICardInformational contentStatus messages, instructions

Example:

powershell
# Display a CPU metric
Add-UIMetricCard -Step 'Dashboard' -Name 'CPU' -Title 'CPU Usage' `
    -Value { (Get-CimInstance Win32_Processor).LoadPercentage } `
    -Unit '%'

# Display a trend chart
Add-UIChartCard -Step 'Dashboard' -Name 'Trends' -Title 'Usage Trends' `
    -ChartType 'Line' -Data $chartData

Documentation: Dashboard Cards Reference

Banner Style Presets ​

Quickly create professional banners using preset styles instead of configuring individual parameters.

Available Presets:

PresetDescription
DefaultStandard theme colors, 180px height
GradientBlue gradient background, 200px height
ImageOptimized for background images, 220px height
MinimalCompact design, 120px height
HeroLarge centered banner, 300px height
AccentGreen accent with hover effect, 160px height

Example:

powershell
# Use a preset
Add-UIBanner -Step 'Dashboard' -Title 'Welcome' -BannerStyle 'Gradient'

# Customize a preset
Add-UIBanner -Step 'Dashboard' -Title 'Welcome' `
    -BannerStyle 'Hero' `
    -BannerConfig @{ Height = 350; TitleFontSize = 52 }

Workflow Features ​

PoshUI.Workflow enables multi-step automated processes with enterprise features.

Capabilities:

  • Task-based execution with progress tracking
  • Approval gates for manual checkpoints
  • Reboot and resume support for long-running processes
  • Inter-task data passing
  • CMTrace-compatible logging

Example:

powershell
New-PoshUIWorkflow -Title 'Server Setup' -ScriptBody {
    Add-UIWorkflowTask -Name 'Install-Features' -Title 'Install Windows Features' `
        -ScriptBlock { Install-WindowsFeature -Name Web-Server }

    Add-UIWorkflowTask -Name 'Configure-IIS' -Title 'Configure IIS' `
        -ScriptBlock { # Configuration script }
}

Show-PoshUIWorkflow -Theme 'Dark'

Documentation: Workflows

Debugging Tools ​

Get-PoshUIDashboard ​

Inspect your dashboard structure during development to verify controls are configured correctly.

When to use:

  • Verify cards are added to the correct steps
  • Check that ScriptBlocks are configured properly
  • Debug why a card isn't displaying
  • Export dashboard structure for documentation

Example:

powershell
# View dashboard summary
Get-PoshUIDashboard

# See all control properties
Get-PoshUIDashboard -IncludeProperties

# Check a specific step
Get-PoshUIDashboard -StepName 'Dashboard'

# Export for analysis
Get-PoshUIDashboard -AsJson | Out-File dashboard-structure.json

Verbose Output ​

Enable detailed output during development to understand what's happening:

powershell
Add-UIMetricCard -Step 'Dashboard' -Name 'CPU' -Title 'CPU' `
    -Value { (Get-CimInstance Win32_Processor).LoadPercentage } -Verbose

Output:

VERBOSE: Adding MetricCard - CPU to step Dashboard
VERBOSE: Executing Value ScriptBlock for MetricCard 'CPU'...
VERBOSE: ScriptBlock returned value: 45
VERBOSE: Successfully added MetricCard control: CPU

Platform ​

Architecture ​

  • Built on .NET Framework 4.8
  • Windows PowerShell 5.1 compatible
  • Windows 10/11 and Server 2016+ support

Theming ​

  • Light and Dark theme support
  • Auto-detect system theme
  • Consistent Windows 11 styling

Logging ​

  • CMTrace-compatible log format
  • Logs stored in $env:LOCALAPPDATA\PoshUI\Logs\
  • Useful for troubleshooting in production

Next Steps ​

  1. Get Started - Create your first wizard or dashboard
  2. Wizards - Build step-by-step guided interfaces
  3. Dashboards - Create monitoring interfaces
  4. Workflows - Orchestrate automated processes
  5. Controls Reference - Explore available controls

Version: 1.0.0 Compatibility: Windows PowerShell 5.1, .NET Framework 4.8
